trustfund: TF022542-PHRD-WOMEN'S ACCESS PROJECT,TF025271-PHRD-SECOND BASIC EDUCATION DEVELOPMENT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Primary Education
            Development Project in Dominican Republic are as follows:
            overall outcome of the project was rated highly
            satisfactory, and the performance of the Bank and the
            Borrower were rated satisfactory. Some of the lessons
            learned from the project are: 1) broad support by
            representatives take holders is a prerequisite for
            successful introduction and implementation of educational
            reform. The ad hoc groups that formed to promote first the
            argument for educational reform and then the development of
            the Plan Decenal accounted in large part for the successful
            start-up and implementation of Plan activities supported by
            the project; 2) when faced with limited institutional
            capacity in the responsible line ministry, it may be better
            to rely on outside capacity and take a phased approach to
            institutional strengthening than to risk delay or even
            failure in initiating a much needed reform or project; and
            3) the ability to take a programmatic approach to project
            design can facilitate innovation and improvements during the
            life of a project.
